Articles.Content:
1 hour ago, Kraken that doesn't exist said:

i checked your mod list and you have KSC Extended and Kopernicus, when i last checked the latest version it worked in was 1.8.1

I didn't include Kopernicus in my 1.9 install, it's not updated yet. KSC Extended has been confirmed to work in 1.9. I think it's really just a RAM issue, because my RAM might be full. 

42 minutes ago, Kerballing (Got Dunked On) said:

Well, use Viking for Mungate's replacement! Then you can use Mariner for Minmus! (although that might be better suited for Duna, actually)

I like the sound of that!

I tried to (again) boot up 1.9, but it always gets stuck on 001 Kerbal Actuators. I tried removing it, but it still gets stuck. Also, when I force quit it, it just freezes and I have to restart to get it to go away. Aaaarrrrggghhhhh! For now I'm just sticking with my 1.7 install.

I'm sorry for keeping you guys in the cold lately, but I've had a few problems with my computer. Thankfully, it's all fixed now. I'm almost done with the X-5, as soon as I get it fixed I'll update ya'll. (I'm Texan okay? Why you bully me?)

Anyways, i thought to make it up to you guys, I'd include some pictures:

https://imgur.com/gallery/aEZx35t

Edited June 22, 2020 by Misguided_Kerbal
I finally got the X-5 to work! I'll be updating later. Once again, sorry for keeping you guys in the cold lately.
btw i saw kopernicus in your mod list, but kopernicus got forked and updated to 1.9.x

I know, it's not Kopernicus that's the problem. You know what, I can finally start that JNSQ save I wanted to though!

Did I mention that I'm killing my Macbook? 

 

so, your mac book dying?

also some mods still not compatible with 1.9

Just now, Kraken that doesn't exist said:

so, your mac book dying?

idk, it still works fine on everything else. I'm just gonna wait for 1.10.

X-4-ES-94 and X-5: The A in KASA (Aeronautics of course. Not Agency!)

While the VAB was working on the CTV+, the engineers at the SPH bought a ES-94 Dart spaceplane for testing purposes.

Spoiler

However, the X-4 didn't make up to what it said it did. In fact, it failed to even reach an apoapsis of 70km. The engineers attributed this to either defects in the aircraft or Valentina's shoddy flying (of course, Jeb claimed that it was Valentina's shoddy flying, and that they should have sent him instead.)

In a few days time, the SPH rolled out a shiny new prototype: the X-5. The X-5 combined things from both the successful X-1.2 and the X-4, and looked sleek. However, in the simulations, it had a few problems, and the engineers hoped that a flight of the new, improved model would work.

Spoiler

The X-5 gracefully skipped into the air and achieved orbit with an acceptable margin. Valentina took this time to snap a few pictures from the cockpit. Deorbit and reentry were also picture perfect. In fact, a bit too perfect and slow for Valentina's liking, so she pushed the X-5 into a deep dive. It performed well, and landed safely. 

 

Spoiler

Sorry for this being a long time coming, the X-5 had some major defects that I had to work out first, and even though we're in quarantine, my KSP time is still limited to about 30 mins - 1 hour a day. Once again, I'm sorry.

 

Edited June 25, 2020 by Misguided_Kerbal

Good posts Misguided_Kerbal, and you seem to have a flair for making really cool looking rockets.

Your aircraft are really good too, although as I totally suck at anything to do with them I tend not to be as interested in them as I do rockets.

13 hours ago, The Flying Kerbal said:

Good posts Misguided_Kerbal, and you seem to have a flair for making really cool looking rockets.

Your aircraft are really good too, although as I totally suck at anything to do with them I tend not to be as interested in them as I do rockets.

Wow, thanks! I don't really think I'm that good at making aircraft though, I looked at a lot of other people's designs before making the X-5, and the first iteration failed so much. But before I downplay myself too much, I would just like to say thanks for the compliments!

Edited June 25, 2020 by Misguided_Kerbal

did i forget to mention kopernicus took longer to update because the last maintainer @Thomas P. dropped out and the mod got forked and updated to 1.9

No, you didn't mention it. But I did check so I know.

If you guys are wondering what I'm up to (no you're not), I posted all the (Useful) KASA crafts on KerbalX:

https://kerbalx.com/IAMNICOM
Well guess what? I just booted up KSP. I've been having problems with my 1.7 save lately, where I can't pick the crew. Today, the problem just got worse. I really need to update.

Hope 1 (Eeloo 1) End of Mission: Last stop on the frontier

While everything else was happening, Eeloo 1 finally reached the end of its lonely trek to Eeloo (or so the engineers thought). In reality, it was too far out from Eeloo's SOI for capture, so it was decided to rename it as Hope 1. Hope 1 set its course onto a Kerbol escape.

Spoiler

Hope 1 successfully did the burn. It also finally discarded its transfer stage, making that the farthest piece of Kerbal debris ever too!

 

 

Spoiler

You might be wondering why I took so long, and why I posted so little. Well, I'm finally migrating to 1.9.1, so I'm a bit busy these days.
made a kerbalX account

So umm... bad news. KASA doesn't work in 1.9.1, and I think I corrupted the save. And stupid me didn't backup it. So yeah... oops. On the bright side, I'm starting a new JNSQ save. Ok I should shut up now.
